title:
Einstein-AdS gravity coupled to nonlinear electrodynamics, magnetic
  black holes, thermodynamics in an extended phase space and Joule--Thomson
  expansion
abstract:
We study Einstein's gravity with negative cosmological constant coupled to
nonlinear electrodynamics proposed earlier. The metric and mass functions and
corrections to the Reissner--Nordstr\"{o}m solution are obtained. Black hole
solutions can have one or two horizons. Thermodynamics and phase transitions of
magnetically charged black holes in Anti-de Sitter spacetime are investigated.
The first law of black hole thermodynamics is formulated and the generalized
Smarr relation is proofed. By calculating the Gibbs free energy and heat
capacity we study the black hole stability. Zero-order (reentrant),
first-order, and second-order phase transitions are analysed. The
Joule--Thomson expansion is considered showing the cooling and heating phase
transitions. It was shown that the principles of causality and unitarity are
satisfied in the model under consideration.
